page.title: 05Framedrum Reservoir
page.content: The {Reservoir's}water supply was originally from Glen Ogil, but it now comes from Lintrathen. It was built in 1909 and was cleaned out for the first time in 1984. This water supplies the town of Arbroath, which needs 3.3 million gallons per day. New pipe lines are being laid to supply Brechin and Montrose. The main reservoir is 760ft above sea_level and the Framedrum Reservoir 467ft .The water then drops down through Muirheads to Arbroath, which is just above sea_level. The water supply for this area comes from LochLee. There is also a Chlorine Treatment House for putting chlorine into the water . There are strict safety precautions and the amount and pressure is checked every second day, the cylinder being changed every two weeks by two men.
